That's great to hear! Incorporating stretching or meditation into your morning routine can be a fantastic way to start the day feeling refreshed and focused. And, getting a smart alarm can definitely help you wake up during a light sleep phase, making it easier to feel rested and alert in the morning.

It's also excellent that you've found a pre-bedtime routine that works for you! Reading a book for at least 20 minutes before lights out is a great way to wind down and disconnect from screens. This can help signal to your brain that it's time to sleep, making it easier to fall asleep and stay asleep throughout the night.

Remember, consistency is key, so try to stick to your routine as much as possible, even on weekends or days off. And don't be too hard on yourself if you miss a day or two – just get back on track as soon as you can.

Also, consider exploring different types of meditation or stretching exercises to find what works best for you. You might find that certain techniques or routines help you feel more energized or focused in the morning. Experimentation is key to finding a routine that you enjoy and can stick to in the long term.

Lastly, don't forget to celebrate your small wins! You've already made progress by establishing a bedtime routine and finding a morning routine that you're excited to try. Keep building on those successes, and you'll be well on your way to developing a consistent wake-up routine that works for you.

How do you plan to incorporate stretching or meditation into your morning routine? Are there any specific techniques or apps you're interested in trying?
